str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
Much, many; often.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To hawk, trade in, deal in for purposes of gain. From kapelos; to retail, i.e. to adulterate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
Opposite, in front (of), over against. From kata and enanti; directly opposite.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
Clearness, sincerity, purity. From eilikrines; clearness, i.e. purity.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
